text:
nt nocturnal frontal lobe epilepsy
What are the genetic changes related to autosomal dominant nocturnal frontal lobe epilepsy ?,"Mutations in the CHRNA2, CHRNA4, and CHRNB2 genes can cause ADNFLE. These genes provide instructions for making different parts (subunits) of a larger molecule called a neuronal nicotinic acetylcholine receptor (nAChR). This receptor plays an important role in chemical signaling between nerve cells (neurons) in the brain.  Communication between neurons depends on chemi
